result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs , fees and DNA surcharges by 6-14-17  or, if not paid, serve 25 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence with Huber privileges.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 17 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court objects to ES.
Court will grant motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law and obtains a valid licsense.

No reply from surety/defendant.

Defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve six months  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 17 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court objects to ES. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs , fees  and  DNA surcharges by 6-14-17  or, if not paid, serve 25  days in the House of Correction consecutive  to any sentence with Huber privileges. 

Court will grant  motion for expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law and obtains a valid licsense. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed..
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant has a new criminal case.  court orders cash bail forfeited.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court grants State's request for adjournment of the sentencing hearing to investigate defendant's possible federal matters and Children's Court matters.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16RM027971  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/13/2016
Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47
Court set bail in the amount of $100.00 cash which can be posted out of custody at clerk of courts office.

Defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Jury in box.  Sworn for the state:  Officer Stuart Sajdak.  Exhibit 9 marked only and exhibit 10 is received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Officer Matthew Thompson.  Defense rests.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness:  Officer Stuart Sajdak and Officer Matthew Thompson.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:10 to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputy Ray Crespo who was duly sworn for that purpose. 

At the hour of 1:30pm  the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of guilty   which was then read. Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrich Michael Taylor in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:05am.   Defense Batson motion challenge is Denied by the Court. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.    Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense. Jury out of box.
